Goddamn that scene pisses me off. I saw both that movie and that godawful Ender's Game adaptation in theaters that year, and fucking Ender's Game was the one that pissed me off less, and the creator of that series is a serious competitor for biggest douche in the universe.

topics.body:
In other awful movie news, "another Paul Verhoeven movie is getting a shitty Pg-13 remake.":http://www.ifc.com/fix/2012/06/starship-troopers-remake-2 In this case its Starship Troopers, which will according to the linked article try to be faithful to the book.

Now, I like Robert Heinlein's books for the most part. He's easily one of my favorite scifi authors, and you should all read Stranger in a Strange Land, The Moon is a Harsh Mistress and Job: A Comedy of Justice.

However, to put it as nicely as I can, Starship Troopers the book is a jingoistic, saber rattling piece of shit. Heinlein wrote it during the Cold War and was by inclination a very hawkish in outlook and it shows painfully in Starship Troopers.
topics.author: 4f41ee04945b701c41002af7

topics.body:
"@gasmaskangel":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/5542fcc36368724a5bd70500#post_5542fcc36368724a5bd70500
I won't deny that that particular scene in Man of Steel was pretty bullshit, but I still enjoyed the rest of the movie regardless (whether I should have or not). 

That said, I don't really have high hopes for a Justice League movie (or any other movies based on DC properties). It seems like most superhero movies aren't allowed to "enjoy themselves" anymore, so to speak. I guess their directors are trying to wash away the stigma caused by Batman Forever/Batman and Robin, but now it seems to be going too far in the opposite direction.
